thread.title: Group posts 50 000 Holocaust documents online
thread.title_full: Group posts 50 000 Holocaust documents online | News24

author: news24.com
title: Group posts 50 000 Holocaust documents online
text:
Kassel - The first 50 000 documents from the International Tracing Service, a group that helps track down those who went missing in the wake of the Holocaust and WWII, have been placed online, the group announced on Wednesday.
The documents, which have been available since 2013 as part of a Memory of the World register collated by the UN conservation agency Unesco, will now be available for free at https://digitalcollections.its-arolsen.org .
The documents include photographs of items confiscated from prisoners in Nazi concentration camps, documents about death marches and files from a search service for lost children in the wake of the war.
The group hopes the documents might be of use to a variety of people, from researchers to victims and their families to students working on school projects.
